meanings.definition: Make (an action or process) happen sooner or be accomplished more quickly.
meanings.sent1: She is expediting the delivery of the package.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to expedite the project to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The chef was expediting the cooking of the meal to avoid burning it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's encouragement expedited the students' learning process.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's quick response expedited the rescue operation.

meanings.definition: Process or facilitate the progress of (a task or action).
meanings.sent1: The secretary is expediting the paperwork for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Using technology can help expedite the data entry process.
meanings.sent3: The robot was expediting the assembly line, impressing the workers.
meanings.sent4: The efficient system expedites the order fulfillment for the customers.
meanings.sent5: The guide's instructions expedited the tourists' exploration of the city.
